title: American_Top_40_1973_February_17th
description:
"We're counting down the hits from the most respected survey in the record business, Billboard's hot 100. I'm Casey Kasem, this is AT40, and the countdown continues on the way to the top."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There is a group with a member who kept his daytime welding job even after the group's first single became a million-seller. He finally quit welding after the group's second hit was well into the top 40.

A listener wants to know if any white artists have ever hit number one on the soul chart. Casey says it's only happened 23 times, four by The King himself.

Casey answers the question, "During the rock era, how many recordings by foreign artists hit number one and who had the second most?" Casey says 34 different foreign recording acts have hit the number one spot on the American chart a total of 62 times, and then gives the details on the rest of the question.

In another Dear Casey letter, "What artist has had the most total weeks at number one, counting all his records?" Casey says that even without counting all his records, he is still number one with 80 weeks at number one!

Yet another listener wants to know if a song sung entirely in a foreign language has ever become number one. Casey says three times, and tells about each one.
